support_summary: TDP-43's C-terminal glycine-rich region has been shown to directly mediate interaction with hnRNPA2/B1.

functions.cellular_process: TDP-43 and hnRNPA2/B1 are both components of the spliceosome and interact to co-regulate the alternative splicing of target pre-mRNAs.
functions.effect_description: The cooperative binding of TDP-43 and hnRNPA2/B1 to pre-mRNAs influences splice site selection, affecting the final protein isoforms produced.
biological_consequence: TDP-43/hnRNPA2 interaction → Co-regulation of splicing targets (e.g., CFTR exon 9) → Altered protein isoform ratios → Disrupted cellular function
specific_effects: Knockdown of hnRNPA2 inhibits the exclusion of CFTR exon 9, a process also modulated by TDP-43.

evidence.paper_title: TDP-43 and FUS/TLS: emerging roles in RNA processing and neurodegeneration
Abnormal Splicing Events due to Loss of Nuclear Function of TDP-43: Pathophysiology and Perspectives

functions.cellular_process: Following cellular stress, both TDP-43 and hnRNPA2 are recruited to and become components of stress granules.
functions.effect_description: This co-localization suggests a functional interaction within stress granules, contributing to the cellular stress response and RNA triage.
biological_consequence: Oxidative stress → Recruitment of TDP-43 and hnRNPA2 to stress granules → Sequestration of RNA and proteins → Modulation of stress response
specific_effects: TDP-43 interacts with hnRNPA2 via its C-terminal glycine-rich domain.

evidence.paper_title: TAR DNA-binding protein 43 (TDP-43) regulates stress granule dynamics via differential regulation of G3BP and TIA-1

mechanism: TDP-43 and hnRNPA2/B1 are both components of the spliceosome and interact to co-regulate the alternative splicing of target pre-mRNAs. Following cellular stress, both TDP-43 and hnRNPA2 are recruited to and become components of stress granules.
effect: The cooperative binding of TDP-43 and hnRNPA2/B1 to pre-mRNAs influences splice site selection, affecting the final protein isoforms produced.; This co-localization suggests a functional interaction within stress granules, contributing to the cellular stress response and RNA triage.
summary: TDP43 activates hnRNPA2/B1 to regulate alternative splicing and stress granule localization, ultimately affecting disrupted cellular function.

evidence.paper_title: TDP-43 and FUS/TLS: emerging roles in RNA processing and neurodegeneration
Abnormal Splicing Events due to Loss of Nuclear Function of TDP-43: Pathophysiology and Perspectives
TAR DNA-binding protein 43 (TDP-43) regulates stress granule dynamics via differential regulation of G3BP and TIA-1
